00075 #define NIL(type)               ((type *) 0)
00076 
00077 #if defined(USE_MM) || defined(MNEMOSYNE)
00078 /*
00079  *  assumes the memory manager is either libmm.a or libmnem.a
00080  *      libmm.a:
00081  *      - allows malloc(0) or realloc(obj, 0)
00082  *      - catches out of memory (and calls MMout_of_memory())
00083  *      - catch free(0) and realloc(0, size) in the macros
00084  *      libmnem.a:
00085  *      - reports memory leaks
00086  *      - is used in conjunction with the mnemalyse postprocessor
00087  */
00088 #ifdef MNEMOSYNE
00089 #include "mnemosyne.h"
00090 #define ALLOC(type, num)        \
00091     ((num) ? ((type *) malloc(sizeof(type) * (num))) : \
00092             ((type *) malloc(sizeof(long))))
00093 #else
00094 #define ALLOC(type, num)        \
00095     ((type *) malloc(sizeof(type) * (num)))
00096 #endif
00097 #define REALLOC(type, obj, num) \
00098     (obj) ? ((type *) realloc((char *) obj, sizeof(type) * (num))) : \
00099             ((type *) malloc(sizeof(type) * (num)))
00100 #define FREE(obj)               \
00101     ((obj) ? (free((char *) (obj)), (obj) = 0) : 0)
00102 #else
00103 /*
00104  *  enforce strict semantics on the memory allocator
00105  *      - when in doubt, delete the '#define USE_MM' above
00106  */
00107 #define ALLOC(type, num)        \
00108     ((type *) MMalloc((long) sizeof(type) * (long) (num)))
00109 #define REALLOC(type, obj, num) \
00110     ((type *) MMrealloc((char *) (obj), (long) sizeof(type) * (long) (num)))
00111 #define FREE(obj)               \
00112     ((obj) ? (free((char *) (obj)), (obj) = 0) : 0)
00113 #endif

00116 /* Ultrix (and SABER) have 'fixed' certain functions which used to be int */
00117 #if defined(ultrix) || defined(SABER) || defined(aiws) || defined(hpux) || defined(apollo) || defined(__osf__) || defined(__SVR4) || defined(__GNUC__)
00118 #define VOID_OR_INT void
00119 #define VOID_OR_CHAR void
00120 #else
00121 #define VOID_OR_INT int
00122 #define VOID_OR_CHAR char
00123 #endif

00148 #else

00185 #ifdef __STDC__
00186 #include <assert.h>
00187 #else
00188 #ifndef NDEBUG
00189 #define assert(ex) {\
00190     if (! (ex)) {\
00191         (void) fprintf(stderr,\
00192             "Assertion failed: file %s, line %d\n\"%s\"\n",\
00193             __FILE__, __LINE__, "ex");\
00194         (void) fflush(stdout);\
00195         abort();\
00196     }\
00197 }
00198 #else
00199 #define assert(ex) ;
00200 #endif
00201 #endif

00204 #define fail(why) {\
00205     (void) fprintf(stderr, "Fatal error: file %s, line %d\n%s\n",\
00206         __FILE__, __LINE__, why);\
00207     (void) fflush(stdout);\
00208     abort();\
00209 }

00212 #ifdef lint
00213 #undef putc                     /* correct lint '_flsbuf' bug */
00214 #undef ALLOC                    /* allow for lint -h flag */
00215 #undef REALLOC
00216 #define ALLOC(type, num)        (((type *) 0) + (num))
00217 #define REALLOC(type, obj, num) ((obj) + (num))
00218 #endif
